newsitem.title: UK: Mexico's TFM raises $593.5 mln via two bonds. [CORRECTED 09:40 GMT]
newsitem.headline: Mexico's TFM raises $593.5 mln via two bonds. [CORRECTED 09:40 GMT]

text.p: TFM S.A. de C.V. has issued two bonds worth a total 593.5 million, lead manager Morgan Stanley said on Thursday.
TFM is owned 80 percent by Grupo TFM, which is guaranteeing both deals, and 20 percent by Mexico.
The company was created as a result of the privatization of the Mexican railroad system and will provide rail transportation services over the Northeast Rail Lines.
